entries.content: Now let me create the build-progress.txt file to document the current status:

entries.detail:
# Build Progress: Project Foundation & Core Data Model
# Spec ID: 002-project-foundation-core-data-model
# Last Updated: 2026-01-11 20:00

## Current Status: PLANNING COMPLETE

---

## ALREADY IMPLEMENTED âœ…

### 1. Xcode Project Setup
- iOS 17+ target with SwiftUI lifecycle
- BodiiApp.swift with @main entry point
- ContentView with tab-based navigation

### 2. Core Data Model (Bodii.xcdatamodeld)
All 9 entities defined with proper relationships:
- User (14 attributes, 8 relationships)
- BodyRecord (7 attributes, 2 relationships)
- MetabolismSnapshot (8 attributes, 2 relationships)
- Food (14 attributes, 2 relationships)
- FoodRecord (10 attributes, 2 relationships)
- ExerciseRecord (10 attributes, 1 relationship)
- SleepRecord (6 attributes, 1 relationship)
- DailyLog (22 attributes, 1 relationship)
- Goal (17 attributes, 1 relationship)

### 3. Folder Structure (Clean Architecture)
- Bodii/App - Entry point and DI container
- Bodii/Presentation/Features/* - Feature-based UI (Views, ViewModels)
- Bodii/Domain - Use cases, entities, interfaces
- Bodii/Data - Repositories, data sources, DTOs
- Bodii/Infrastructure - Persistence, HealthKit, Network
- Bodii/Shared - Enums, Utils, Extensions

### 4. PersistenceController
- Singleton with shared instance
- Preview instance for SwiftUI
- save(), newBackgroundContext(), performBackgroundTask()
- Lightweight migration support
- DEBUG verifyModelLoaded() helper

---

## REMAINING WORK (17 Subtasks)

### Phase 1: Enum Definitions (9 subtasks)
- [ ] 1.1 Gender enum (male/female)
- [ ] 1.2 ActivityLevel enum (5 levels with TDEE multipliers)
- [ ] 1.3 MealType enum (breakfast/lunch/dinner/snack)
- [ ] 1.4 ExerciseType enum (8 types with MET values)
- [ ] 1.5 Intensity enum (low/medium/high with multipliers)
- [ ] 1.6 FoodSource enum (kfdaAPI/usdaAPI/userCreated)
- [ ] 1.7 GoalType enum (lose/maintain/gain)
- [ ] 1.8 SleepStatus enum (5 statuses with duration thresholds)
- [ ] 1.9 QuantityUnit enum (serving/gram)

### Phase 2: Utility Services (4 subtasks)
- [ ] 2.1 DateUtils (02:00 sleep boundary logic)
- [ ] 2.2 ValidationService (input range validation)
- [ ] 2.3 Date+Extensions (convenience methods)
- [ ] 2.4 Decimal+Extensions (Core Data helpers)

### Phase 3: Unit Tests & Verification (4 subtasks)
- [ ] 3.1 DateUtilsTests
- [ ] 3.2 ValidationServiceTests
- [ ] 3.3 SleepStatusTests
- [ ] 3.4 Core Data Model Verification

---

## KEY REFERENCES

### Validation Ranges (from spec.md and edge_cases.md)
- Height: 100-250cm
- Weight: 20-300kg
- Body Fat: 1-60%
- Name: 1-20 characters
- Exercise Duration: min 1 minute
- Food Quantity: min 0.1

### Sleep Boundary Logic (from edge_cases.md)
```swift
// 02:00 ~ ë‹¤ìŒë‚  02:00 = í•˜ë£¨
// 00:00 ~ 01:59 â†’ previous day
// 02:00 ~ 23:59 â†’ current day
func getSleepDate(for date: Date) -> Date {
    let hour = Calendar.current.component(.hour, from: date)
    if hour < 2 {
        return Calendar.current.date(byAdding: .day, value: -1, to: date)!
    }
    return date
}
```

### Activity Level Multipliers (from algorithm.md)
| Level | Multiplier |
|-------|-----------|
| 1 (Sedentary) | 1.2 |
| 2 (Light) | 1.375 |
| 3 (Moderate) | 1.55 |
| 4 (Active) | 1.725 |
| 5 (Very Active) | 1.9 |

### Sleep Status Thresholds (from ERD.md)
| Status | Minutes |
|--------|---------|
| bad (0) | < 330 |
| soso (1) | 330-389 |
| good (2) | 390-449 |
| excellent (3) | 450-540 |
| oversleep (4) | > 540 |

---

## NOTES
- Korean localization required for all display names
- Error messages must be in Korean
- All enums use Int16 rawValue to match Core Data attributes

I've created a comprehensive implementation plan for the **Project Foundation & Core Data Model** spec. Here's the summary:

## Implementation Plan Created âœ…

### What's Already Done (4/6 Acceptance Criteria)
| Component | Status |
|-----------|--------|
| Xcode project with iOS 17+ and SwiftUI | âœ… Complete |
| Core Data model with 9 entities | âœ… Complete |
| MVVM folder structure (Clean Architecture) | âœ… Complete |
| PersistenceController with save/fetch | âœ… Complete |
| DateUtils with 02:00 sleep boundary | â³ Pending |
| ValidationService for input ranges | â³ Pending |

### Implementation Plan: 5 Phases, 32 Subtasks

| Phase | Title | Subtasks | Est. Time |
|-------|-------|----------|-----------|
| 1 | Enum Definitions & Type Safety | 10 | ~130 min |
| 2 | Utility Services | 5 | ~130 min |
| 3 | Domain Entities | 9 | ~180 min |
| 4 | Core Data Entity Extensions | 4 | ~115 min |
| 5 | Testing & Verification | 4 | ~80 min |

### Key Deliverables

**Phase 1 - Enums:**
- Gender, ActivityLevel, MealType, ExerciseType
- Intensity, FoodSource, GoalType, SleepStatus, QuantityUnit
- Constants file with validation ranges

**Phase 2 - Utilities (Critical for Acceptance):**
- `DateUtils` - 02:00 sleep boundary logic
- `ValidationService` - height, weight, body fat, etc. validation
- Date and Decimal extensions, Formatters

**Phase 3 - Domain Entities:**
- 9 pure Swift structs mirroring Core Data entities
- User, BodyRecord, MetabolismSnapshot, Food, FoodRecord, ExerciseRecord, SleepRecord, DailyLog, Goal

**Phase 4 - Core Data Extensions:**
- `toDomain()` and `update(from:)` methods
- Bridge between Core Data and domain models

**Phase 5 - Testing:**
- Unit tests for DateUtils (boundary cases)
- Unit tests for ValidationService (all ranges)
- Build verification

### Files Updated
- `./.auto-claude/specs/002-project-foundation-core-data-model/implementation_plan.json`
- `./.auto-claude/specs/002-project-foundation-core-data-model/build-progress.txt`

entries.content:
Perfect! I've successfully completed subtask 1.4 - **Define ExerciseType enum with 8 exercise types and MET values by intensity**. Here's what was accomplished:

## âœ… Implementation Complete

### Created: `Bodii/Shared/Enums/ExerciseType.swift`

**Features implemented:**
1. âœ… **ExerciseType enum with Int16 rawValue** - Compatible with Core Data
2. âœ… **8 Exercise types** with correct rawValue mapping:
   - walking (0), running (1), cycling (2), swimming (3)
   - weight (4), crossfit (5), yoga (6), other (7)
3. âœ… **MET values by intensity** - `metValue(for:)` method returns appropriate MET values:
   - **Walking**: 3.5 (low) / 4.0 (medium) / 5.0 (high)
   - **Running**: 7.0 / 8.0 / 10.0
   - **Cycling**: 5.0 / 6.0 / 8.0
   - **Swimming**: 6.0 / 7.0 / 9.0
   - **Weight**: 4.0 / 6.0 / 8.0
   - **Crossfit**: 6.0 / 8.0 / 10.0
   - **Yoga**: 2.5 / 3.0 / 4.0
   - **Other**: 4.0 / 5.0 / 6.0
4. âœ… **Korean localized display names** - All exercise types have Korean names
5. âœ… **Identifiable extension** - SwiftUI List/ForEach compatibility

### Git Commits:
- âœ… Main implementation committed
- âœ… Implementation plan updated
- âœ… Build progress updated

### Quality Checklist:
- âœ… Follows patterns from reference files (Gender, ActivityLevel, MealType)
- âœ… No console.log/print debugging statements
- âœ… Error handling in place (default cases for invalid intensity values)
- âœ… Clean commits with descriptive messages
- âœ… Documentation with Korean comments explaining MET values

**Progress:** Phase 1 is now 4/10 subtasks complete (Gender, ActivityLevel, MealType, ExerciseType) âœ¨

entries.detail:
1â†’# Project Foundation & Core Data Model
     2â†’
     3â†’Set up Xcode project with SwiftUI, MVVM architecture, Core Data persistence layer with 9 entities (User, BodyRecord, MetabolismSnapshot, Food, FoodRecord, ExerciseRecord, SleepRecord, DailyLog, Goal), and utility services for date handling and input validation.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Rationale
     6â†’Essential infrastructure for all other features. Core Data provides reliable local storage addressing competitor pain points of app crashes and data loss (InBody, Noom, MyFitnessPal data corruption incidents). Local-first approach ensures privacy and reliability.
     7â†’
     8â†’## User Stories
     9â†’- As a developer, I want a well-structured project so that I can build features efficiently
    10â†’- As a user, I want my data stored locally so that it's always available even offline
    11â†’
    12â†’## Acceptance Criteria
    13â†’- [ ] Xcode project created with iOS 17+ target and SwiftUI lifecycle
    14â†’- [ ] Core Data model implements all 9 entities from ERD
    15â†’- [ ] MVVM folder structure established (Views, ViewModels, Models, Services, Utils)
    16â†’- [ ] PersistenceController manages Core Data stack with save/fetch operations
    17â†’- [ ] DateUtils handles 02:00 sleep boundary logic correctly
    18â†’- [ ] ValidationService validates all input ranges (height 100-250cm, weight 20-300kg, etc.)
    19â†’

entries.content:
## âœ… Subtask 1.8 Completed: SleepStatus Enum

I've successfully implemented the SleepStatus enum with all required functionality:

### Implementation Details

**Created:** `Bodii/Shared/Enums/SleepStatus.swift`

**Features:**
- âœ… Enum with `Int16` rawValue for Core Data compatibility
- âœ… 5 status cases: `bad (0)`, `soso (1)`, `good (2)`, `excellent (3)`, `oversleep (4)`
- âœ… Static factory method `from(durationMinutes:)` to determine status from sleep duration
- âœ… Duration thresholds correctly implemented:
  - Bad: < 330 minutes (< 5.5 hours)
  - Soso: 330-389 minutes (5.5-6.5 hours)
  - Good: 390-449 minutes (6.5-7.5 hours)
  - Excellent: 450-540 minutes (7.5-9 hours)
  - Oversleep: > 540 minutes (> 9 hours)
- âœ… Korean localized display names with emoji indicators (ğŸ”´ğŸŸ¡ğŸŸ¢ğŸ”µğŸŸ )
- âœ… `Identifiable` extension for SwiftUI compatibility
- âœ… Comprehensive documentation with examples

### Quality Checklist
- âœ… Follows patterns from reference files (Gender, ActivityLevel, GoalType)
- âœ… No debugging statements
- âœ… Error handling not applicable (enum definition)
- âœ… Clean commit: `79c621d auto-claude: 1.8 - Define SleepStatus enum with duration thresholds f`
- âœ… Implementation plan updated to "completed" status

### Commit
```
79c621d auto-claude: 1.8 - Define SleepStatus enum with duration thresholds f
```

The implementation follows the established enum pattern in the codebase and correctly implements all acceptance criteria from the specification.

entries.content: Excellent! Let me create a quick summary of what was completed:

## âœ… Subtask 1.10 Completed Successfully!

I've successfully created the **Constants.swift** file with all required app-wide constants. Here's what was implemented:

### ğŸ“‹ What Was Created

**File:** `Bodii/Shared/Utils/Constants.swift`

### âœ¨ Features Implemented

1. **Validation Ranges** - All input validation limits:
   - Height: 100-250 cm
   - Weight: 20-300 kg
   - Body Fat Percent: 3-60%
   - Muscle Mass: 10-60 kg
   - Birth Year: 1900 to current year (dynamic)
   - Name: 1-20 characters
   - Exercise Duration: 1-480 minutes
   - Food Serving: 0.1-100 servings
   - Food Gram: 1-10,000 grams

2. **Sleep Boundary Configuration**:
   - Boundary hour: 2 (02:00 sleep boundary logic)

3. **Default Values**:
   - Activity Level: 3 (moderate)
   - Serving Size: 100g
   - Goal Type: 1 (maintain)

4. **BMR Calculation Constants**:
   - Male: Mifflin-St Jeor coefficients (10, 6.25, 5, +5)
   - Female: Mifflin-St Jeor coefficients (10, 6.25, 5, -161)

5. **Calorie Adjustment Constants**:
   - Calories per kg: 7,700 kcal
   - Max weekly loss: 1 kg
   - Max weekly gain: 0.5 kg

6. **Macro Ratios**:
   - Carbs: 4 kcal/g
   - Protein: 4 kcal/g
   - Fat: 9 kcal/g

### ğŸ¯ Design Patterns Used

- **Enum as Namespace**: Using nested enums to organize constants and prevent instantiation
- **Type Safety**: Proper typing (Double for measurements, Int for counts)
- **Documentation**: Comprehensive Korean comments following existing code style
- **Computed Property**: Dynamic max birth year that stays current

### âœ… Quality Checklist

- [x] Follows patterns from reference files (Gender, ActivityLevel, SleepStatus)
- [x] No console.log/print debugging statements
- [x] Error handling in place (N/A for constants)
- [x] Clean commit with descriptive message
- [x] Implementation plan updated (subtask 1.10 marked as completed)
- [x] Phase 1 marked as completed (all 10 subtasks done!)

### ğŸ‰ Phase 1 Complete!

All 10 subtasks in **Phase 1: Enum Definitions & Type Safety** are now complete:
- âœ… 1.1 - Gender Enum
- âœ… 1.2 - ActivityLevel Enum
- âœ… 1.3 - MealType Enum
- âœ… 1.4 - ExerciseType Enum
- âœ… 1.5 - Intensity Enum
- âœ… 1.6 - FoodSource Enum
- âœ… 1.7 - GoalType Enum
- âœ… 1.8 - SleepStatus Enum
- âœ… 1.9 - QuantityUnit Enum
- âœ… 1.10 - Constants File (just completed!)

The project is ready to proceed to **Phase 2: Utility Services** (DateUtils, ValidationService, Extensions, Formatters).

entries.content:
Excellent! I've successfully completed **Subtask 2.1 - DateUtils** for the Project Foundation & Core Data Model. Here's a summary of what was implemented:

## âœ… Completed: DateUtils with 02:00 Sleep Boundary Logic

### Implementation Details

**File Created:** `Bodii/Shared/Utils/DateUtils.swift`

### Key Features Implemented:

1. **Sleep Boundary Logic** â­ (CRITICAL)
   - `getLogicalDate(for:)` - Returns previous day if hour < 2 (01:59â†’prev day, 02:00â†’current day)
   - `isNewDayForSleep(at:)` - Checks if time is past 02:00 boundary

2. **Day Boundary Helpers**
   - `startOfDay(for:)` - Returns 00:00:00 for a given date
   - `endOfDay(for:)` - Returns 23:59:59 for a given date

3. **Korean Locale Date Formatting** ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡·
   - `formatFullDate()` - "2024ë…„ 01ì›” 15ì¼"
   - `formatShortDate()` - "1ì›” 15ì¼"
   - `formatDateWithWeekday()` - "1ì›” 15ì¼ (ì›”)"
   - `formatTime()` - "14:30"
   - `formatDateTime()` - "1ì›” 15ì¼ 14:30"
   - `format(_:format:)` - Custom format support

4. **Date Comparison Methods**
   - `isSameDay(_:_:)` - Compare if two dates are the same day
   - `isToday(_:)` - Check if date is today
   - `daysBetween(_:and:)` - Calculate days between dates

5. **Age Calculation**
   - `age(from:referenceDate:)` - Calculate age from birthdate

### Quality Checklist âœ…
- [x] Follows patterns from reference files (Gender.swift, Constants.swift)
- [x] No console.log/print debugging statements
- [x] Error handling in place (guard statements with safe fallbacks)
- [x] Comprehensive Korean documentation with examples
- [x] Clean commit with descriptive message

### Commits Created:
1. `c39c4cd` - Main implementation of DateUtils
2. `39b02be` - Updated progress tracking (implementation_plan.json & build-progress.txt)

### Progress Update:
- **Phase 1** (Enum Definitions & Type Safety): âœ… **COMPLETE** (10/10 subtasks)
- **Phase 2** (Utility Services): ğŸ”„ **IN PROGRESS** (1/5 subtasks complete)
- **Overall Progress**: 11/32 subtasks complete (34%)

The implementation is ready and follows all acceptance criteria. The next subtask is **2.2 ValidationService** for input range validation.
I'll help you implement the input validation service with all range checks from the spec. Let me start by reading the relevant files to understand the requirements and current state.
Let me read the existing implementation to understand the code patterns I should follow.

entries.detail:
1â†’# Project Foundation & Core Data Model
     2â†’
     3â†’Set up Xcode project with SwiftUI, MVVM architecture, Core Data persistence layer with 9 entities (User, BodyRecord, MetabolismSnapshot, Food, FoodRecord, ExerciseRecord, SleepRecord, DailyLog, Goal), and utility services for date handling and input validation.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Rationale
     6â†’Essential infrastructure for all other features. Core Data provides reliable local storage addressing competitor pain points of app crashes and data loss (InBody, Noom, MyFitnessPal data corruption incidents). Local-first approach ensures privacy and reliability.
     7â†’
     8â†’## User Stories
     9â†’- As a developer, I want a well-structured project so that I can build features efficiently
    10â†’- As a user, I want my data stored locally so that it's always available even offline
    11â†’
    12â†’## Acceptance Criteria
    13â†’- [ ] Xcode project created with iOS 17+ target and SwiftUI lifecycle
    14â†’- [ ] Core Data model implements all 9 entities from ERD
    15â†’- [ ] MVVM folder structure established (Views, ViewModels, Models, Services, Utils)
    16â†’- [ ] PersistenceController manages Core Data stack with save/fetch operations
    17â†’- [ ] DateUtils handles 02:00 sleep boundary logic correctly
    18â†’- [ ] ValidationService validates all input ranges (height 100-250cm, weight 20-300kg, etc.)
    19â†’

## âœ… Subtask 2.3 Complete: Date+Extensions

I've successfully implemented the convenience extensions for the Date type. Here's what was delivered:

### Implementation Summary

**File Created:** `Bodii/Shared/Extensions/Date+Extensions.swift`

**All Acceptance Criteria Met:**
- âœ… `startOfDay` computed property - Returns date at 00:00:00
- âœ… `endOfDay` computed property - Returns date at 23:59:59
- âœ… `age(from:)` static method - Calculates age from birth date
- âœ… `isSameDay(as:)` method - Compares if two dates are the same day
- âœ… `isToday` computed property - Checks if date is today
- âœ… `daysBetween(and:)` method - Calculates day difference
- âœ… `formatted(style:)` method - Korean locale formatting with type-safe FormatStyle enum

### Key Features

1. **Natural Swift API**: Provides instance methods/properties that delegate to DateUtils
   - `date.startOfDay` vs `DateUtils.startOfDay(for: date)`
   
2. **Type-Safe Formatting**: FormatStyle enum with 5 options:
   - `.full` â†’ "2024ë…„ 01ì›” 15ì¼"
   - `.short` â†’ "1ì›” 15ì¼"
   - `.withWeekday` â†’ "1ì›” 15ì¼ (ì›”)"
   - `.time` â†’ "14:30"
   - `.dateTime` â†’ "1ì›” 15ì¼ 14:30"

3. **Comprehensive Documentation**: Korean comments with usage examples for all methods

4. **Follows Patterns**: Consistent with existing codebase style (Gender.swift, DateUtils.swift)

### Commits
- âœ… `96c7cc6` - Implementation with comprehensive documentation
- âœ… `0524b44` - Updated implementation plan to mark subtask completed

### Quality Checklist
- âœ… Follows patterns from reference files
- âœ… No debugging statements
- âœ… Proper error handling via DateUtils delegation
- âœ… Clean commits with descriptive messages
- âœ… Plan updated with status and detailed notes

**Next up:** Subtask 2.4 - Decimal+Extensions for Core Data helpers

entries.detail:
1â†’# Project Foundation & Core Data Model
     2â†’
     3â†’Set up Xcode project with SwiftUI, MVVM architecture, Core Data persistence layer with 9 entities (User, BodyRecord, MetabolismSnapshot, Food, FoodRecord, ExerciseRecord, SleepRecord, DailyLog, Goal), and utility services for date handling and input validation.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Rationale
     6â†’Essential infrastructure for all other features. Core Data provides reliable local storage addressing competitor pain points of app crashes and data loss (InBody, Noom, MyFitnessPal data corruption incidents). Local-first approach ensures privacy and reliability.
     7â†’
     8â†’## User Stories
     9â†’- As a developer, I want a well-structured project so that I can build features efficiently
    10â†’- As a user, I want my data stored locally so that it's always available even offline
    11â†’
    12â†’## Acceptance Criteria
    13â†’- [ ] Xcode project created with iOS 17+ target and SwiftUI lifecycle
    14â†’- [ ] Core Data model implements all 9 entities from ERD
    15â†’- [ ] MVVM folder structure established (Views, ViewModels, Models, Services, Utils)
    16â†’- [ ] PersistenceController manages Core Data stack with save/fetch operations
    17â†’- [ ] DateUtils handles 02:00 sleep boundary logic correctly
    18â†’- [ ] ValidationService validates all input ranges (height 100-250cm, weight 20-300kg, etc.)
    19â†’
